abstract: Rock band Coldplay, which has released album Mylo Xyloto, finds itself shouldering strange burden of being one of the only rock bands capable of rivaling album sales of biggest pop stars; band's success or failure may well be an indicator of the future commercial viability of rock.
snippet: With the release of “Mylo Xyloto” this month, Coldplay has had to prove itself a worthy inheritor to the biggest-band-in-the-world title and savior of the commercial viability of rock.
lead_paragraph: With the release of “Mylo Xyloto” this month, Coldplay has had to prove itself a worthy inheritor to the biggest-band-in-the-world title and savior of the commercial viability of rock.

headline.main: Chris Martin of Coldplay Asks: What Would Bruce Do?
headline.seo: Chris Martin of Coldplay Discusses ‘Mylo Xyloto’
